**Personnel #:** D-41562

**Clearance:** Level-0

**Pronouns:** she/her

**Nationality:** United States of America

**Prior Profession:** Software Engineer

**DOB:** 19â–ˆâ–ˆ/â–ˆâ–ˆ/â–ˆâ–ˆ

**IPLS:**[[footnote]]Involuntary Personnel Loyalty Score, from A (most loyal) to F (least loyal).[[/footnote]] B

**Disposability Rating:** 4

**Medical Notes:**
* Class-2 Amnestic Resistance
* Medium Cognitive Resistance Value (9.3)
* Dislikes nuts (not allergic)

[[span class="page-header"]]**[[[SCP-5633]]]**: This Will Require A Great Amount of Blood (##green|+%%rating%%##) (%%comments%% ðŸ’¬)[[/span]]
Written with: [[*user Rex Atlas]], [[*user Captain Kirby]], [[*user JackalRelated]], [[*user magna2s]], [[*user Modulum]], [[*user Rounderhouse]], [[*user Sterbai]], [[*user Tufto]], [[*user Uncle Nicolini]], [[*user Woedenaz]], [[*user Yossipossi]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
SCP-5633 is a large humanoid body located approximately 50m underground. The inside of SCP-5633 consists of enlarged veins, and steel scaffolding. The veins contain liquid that is both red and black in coloration, and highly viscous. Pipes extracting liquid from SCP-5633's veins are located along its arms, legs and back.
[[/div]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
This is contrary to behavior of other documented apex-tier pluripotent entities, which often engage in behaviors such as accruing worshippers, creating paranormal artifacts, or intervening to achieve certain outcomes. Instead, its primary interest seems to be in the well-being of itself and SCP-8998-1.
[[/div]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
Fae shook her head. "I really don't know. But â€” at least we can make his last week here a happy one."

[[div class="blockquote"]]
[[module ListPages name="pumpkin-mystery" limit="1"]]
[[span class="page-header"]]**[[[pumpkin-mystery|The Pumpkin Mystery]]]**: The Pumpkin Mystery (##green|+%%rating%%##) (%%comments%% ðŸ’¬)[[/span]]
For: [[[jam-con-2021|JamCon 2021]]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
Early on the morning after, residents gathered in shock before the ruins of our Civic Center, surrounded by uprooted trees and shreds of pumpkins throughout the park.
